website_summaries.verdict: A high efficiency propane tankless water heater that is designated for installation outdoors.
pros: This tankless water heater is certified for use in mobile homes and features an electronic ignition to help save you money on fuel costs
The temperature range of this unit is from 120°F to 140°F
cons: Some individuals expressed a bit of frustration with the lack of clarity regarding the installation instructions

customer_reviews.title: Super Energy Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to get a Gas Tankless water heater at first. But after doing the research decided to get the Industry Best - Rinnai. The contractor was impressed by the build quality and the installation kit. There was a small issue on my Rinnai Tankless. The temperature control module was defective. I called Rinnai support and they sent out a new control board the next day. The great thing about this product was, I had hot water although the processing board was defective. 30 days after install I note my Utility bill was more than cut in half. Should have purchased alot sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Corwin Green

customer_reviews.title: great great great
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic !!! We replaced an EZ Tankless water heater with this one, what a complete world of difference between the two of them. Rinnai is so much more efficient and works perfect. No more scalding hot or ice cold showers. I love the remote thermostat so you can adjust the temperature, so no worries if little ones are going to pour a bath that is too hot. I can not say enough good about this product. We purchased this along with a value set for easy cleaning and maintenance, I suggest that you think about putting a inline prefilter system to maximize the life of the heater.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Very good replacement for tank on a 2 bed 1 bath rental home.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on a rental property back in March '18 to replace a standard tank whose pilot blew out regularly. So far, so good. Tenant has not called for service so I'm happy. You will need to flush this with vinegar every couple years so be prepared to call a plumber or shell out for a sub pump, bucket and some hoses to do the job. I always worry about the inevitable electronic issues with these units like control PCB failure. I own a couple of Rinnai's and so far that has not happened.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Deacon

customer_reviews.title: It uses more amps than a standard 120 amp panel has available.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't use it and I'd like to return it, but it's past the allotted time. You should tell the buyer's up front that it takes a dedicated high amp that uses almost as much amps as the entire 120 amp standard electrical service on homes below two thousand square feet.
customer_reviews.author: floyd

customer_reviews.title: I can't enough good things about this item
customer_reviews.text: I can't enough good things about this item! Instant hot water, no fear of flooding, attractive & modern look, didigal control panel, it's actually using less gas since it only uses gas while working..A++ I highly recommend buying one. It's not cheap but will pay for itself in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Tobi

customer_reviews.title: Get a Rinnai
customer_reviews.text: Our last Rinnai (manufactured in 2001) quit heating. Instead of calling a plumber familiar with Rinnai (only one in our area), paying for a service call, waiting for the part, and paying again to have the part installed on a 19 year old unit we just bought a new one. Nineteen years is a good-run for a water heater. Only drawback. The new unit only allows settings of 115 & 120 Fahrenheit. The old unit went to 140 Fahrenheit and I used 140 to sterilize my canning jars in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. B. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say enough about how much I LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: takes 15 seconds to get warm (at nearest point,) and only 30 before it's too hot to touch. I have been going through approximately 1/4-1/3 of the propane by switching to this water heater. I would buy again in a heartbeat and I would recommend to anyone. Also was really easy to install. Was installed in less than an hour, but we read directions and got all materials prior to installation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Costs More; But Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Well designed and equally well built. Matching internal house-wall thermostat is fully adjustable; and, can even be increased to commercial 140 degree max, by manually changing settings in the box itself. Took us through Hurricane Irma without a problem. You may have to remove shower-head water-flow restriction inserts, though, to meet the unit's minimum-flow requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Back-up Guy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what happened  !!
customer_reviews.text: The main hanging bracket had been badly bent some how. This indicated the device had taken a sharp fall. As I had finished (so I thought) taping for shipment and tipped the heater backward on my truck for loading the bottom of the entire package started to come off. I don't know how the driver missed this defect. Fortunately I only live a block from the UPS shipping depot. The fellow there repaired the container. I to want have you folks send a new heater ASAP please !!!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Hagan

customer_reviews.title: 🎵The heat is on! 🎵
customer_reviews.text: We had our first Rinnai for about ten years. We live in Texas and was hit with a hard freeze that surprised us last winter. We turned off the propane attempting to prevent the water from freezing. DO NOT DO THIS!!! LOL! Needless to say it burst. So we had to buy a new one. Upon installing our new Rinnai, we seen in the instructions that the heater has a function to prevent the water from freezing in such occasions. That's what manuel's are for. Lol! If you are considering a tankless water heater for the first time, BUT ONE! They are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: kellystewart2005

customer_reviews.title: Provisional Review
customer_reviews.text: This unit, an outdoor mounted V94EN, has not been installed yet because our plumber has been tied up completing a major job for a commercial customer. The V94EN will replace a Rinnai Continuum that we had installed over 17 years ago and which has performed flawlessly and still provides hot water. Our excellent experience with the Continuum has made us committed Rinnai customers, and we have every expectation that this current model, with its inevitable technological upgrades, will keep us entirely satisfied. We shall submit another review once the new unit has been installed and in operation for a few months. Incidentally, the V94EN was very well packed and arrived in pristine condition.
customer_reviews.author: Medimundo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We were so nervous about ordering this product from Amazon, but after reading all the reviews, we took a chance. Glad we did. Good product, fairly easy to install with detailed instructions. We have a mobile home that needed a new hot water heater, and this was recommended for that purpose. One review recommended we buy the extra valves so we can release water when the temps drop dangerously low. Yes, do that. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Flatrockmama

customer_reviews.title: Go Tankless!!!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE our tankless hot water heater. There are some for inside and some for outside...ours is outside. It was super easy to hook up (we did have a certified installer friend to help, but it was still extremely easy). I LOVE LONG hot showers and this fits the bill!!! Then my husband can shower immediately following with HOT water as well!!! We'll never go back to the old fashioned tank!!! :-D LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: We did get a plumber to install it but he told us this was an awesome price & he likes this brand
customer_reviews.text: Rinnai far exceeds the value of the Bosch we had!! We did get a plumber to install it but he told us this was an awesome price & he likes this brand. The only one he recommends. I love having a tankless. You never run out of hot water. They can't burst & ruin your floors. This is the best one we've seen & the price is great! Don't waste your money on a Bosch which is suppose to be such a good brand. We had a Rinnai before & when we moved for some reason I don't remember we got Bosch. Never again! Always a Rinnai!
customer_reviews.author: D. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy open box!
customer_reviews.text: Because what human would put a $500 unboxed 50lb water heater in a box twice it's size with about 5 pieces of paper. I'll be lucky if it works. I'll update this after installed. But... Really? UPDATE... DOES NOT WORK. ERROR CODE 71 BAD CIRCUIT BOARD. Again...it's disappointing that Amazon would allow such a product to be sold and shipped. Rinnai says warranty is void due to it being open box.
customer_reviews.author: shawnsoldit

customer_reviews.title: Nice product; Lousy Shipping Packaging
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly nice tankless water heaters. The packaging is inadequate for shipping. I ended up accepting the second one with some damage to the front case because I ran out of time for the installation. If I ever purchase this product again, I will buy local where I can inspect it before paying. Update- this water heater is a real pleasure. I have hot water all day long.
customer_reviews.author: John Layman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent -- but be aware of maintenance needs before investing.
customer_reviews.text: Uninterrupted supply as soon as the hot water flows through. Well crafted, easy installation. Note -- with any on demand heater you NEED to get and install the isolation valves (pictured) and you NEED to get an immersion pump and a couple washing machine hoses. You MUST use these to descale it from time to time it it WILL lime up and fail. You can have a plumber do it, but it's very simple and there are videos on YouTube to show you how. Provided you're willing to maintain it, it should last many, many years
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality construction, works as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this installed for two years now and it is flawless. I am not a plumber but with the good instructions it was easy (though not cheap) for me to install. I bought the one to work with propane and we have been saving about $200 a year on our bills because the unit does not have to keep water hot all the time and it does not have a pilot light.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Soreng

customer_reviews.title: Best water heater.......
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a tankless water heater but I promise iwill never be without one again. This thing rocks. Water heats up all the way at the otherside of the house as quick or quicker then my old tank water heater. I would highly recommend this water heater. BTW - I have a 1780sq ft home
customer_reviews.author: Ice1chris

customer_reviews.title: It works great!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a dead old school 30 yrs water heater with this instant unit. It has been 3-4 months and so far it is working just fine. The unit is installed in Southern California USA and using a 1/2 (.5) inch gas pipe and set to default 120 Fahrenheit degrees. Our gas bill was reduced ~$25/month so far, cannot wait to compare it to the winter months. For pipe sizes, refer to the Rinnai "Gas Line Sizing table" FAQ on their site. Pipe size has a dependency on distamce
customer_reviews.author: Shabuboy

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to replace your water heater
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was very fast and we got a local plumber to remove the old one & install this new one for $200 labor. Before ordering this water heater, we called around to get a new one and got a lot of runaround by plumbing companies. We had been quote over $3000-$4000 and several days before anyone could even come out to look at it. We found a local (one man) plumber that told us to get the water heater through Amazon and he would only charge $200 to replace it. This saved us a lot and will definitely recommmend the plumber and this water heater!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This water heater works great, exactly as advertised so far. I gave it 5 stars under "Easy to Install" even though it is quite a job unless you're replacing a tankless water heater in the same location. If you have regular water heater it can turn into a huge project depending on how far you will have to run water lines, electrical and gas piping. If you plan on installing it yourself you will need to be confrontable working with electrical, plumbing and gas.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like that the temp only reaches 120 degrees. This is not stated in the info here on amazon info of the product. DOESNT COME OUT HOT. Also product can’t handle multiple use of washer, sink usage, dishwasher. Losses pressure and heat if your in the shower. This product was shipped & damaged along the way. Item should have been properly packaged. arrived damaged. Also didn’t come with the control to turn the temperature up. The box said it did.
customer_reviews.author: Annett Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Installed but No Remote Included
customer_reviews.text: My licensed plumber went to install and realize that the remote was not included he has installed many of Rinnai outdoor water heaters and he has never seen the remote not included. So one to two weeks without hot water because he didn't want to bypass any of the settings and void my warranty. When I bought the remote it automatically popped up with a warranty why couldn't this product automatically pop up with the remote so I could have ordered them both together. Horrible customer experience
customer_reviews.author: Dina P. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Space saver. Energy saver
customer_reviews.text: Glad I waited for shipping. Replaced rusted tank in my garage with this outdoor unit. Instant hot water, more garage space, no special venting through roof, located closer to my fixtures. Tested on two showers and three faucets at once, it worked. Some reviews say its noisy, but it sounds like a small space heater to me. I forgot to run wiring for the remote, but realized I don’t even need it. It just works as is.
customer_reviews.author: scott terrill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hot water solution for our Off Grid Tiny Cabin at 8400' in Colorado
customer_reviews.text: After realizing that when the instructions call for 3/4" gas supply they mean it. This was a replacement for a hand me down hot water heater that used 1/2" gas pipe and I really was hoping to just swap out with this new Rinnai heater without changing the plumbing. As you can imagine that didn't work and heater wouldn't ignite due to lack of adequate gas pressure and volume. Once I properly sized the gas pipe to 3/4" this amazing heater fired up and has worked flawlessly at high attitude. I love how it has dip switches for adjusting to whatever altitude you install this at.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Kniegge

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 15 year old Rinnai Continuum that stopped working due to a power surge. Installed this new unit 11 days ago and it is working great so far. Note that if you want your water temperature higher than 120 degrees you must flip switch 6 in bank 1 of the unit. It will then provide hot water up to 140 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: S. LaSale

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed about priced with similar models so I figured I'd give it a shot but the delivery was a horrible process and that was just the start. Not hard to install, just weird that it comes with a 3/4" gas line. It's a hit or miss depending on how you look at it, water comes out hot after about about a minute at least so it's annoying if you want quick hot water on demand this is not your unit. Once it gets hot it will keep pumping it out but there's definitely a longer warm up period EVERYTIME you want hot water.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: It turns to freezing cold water about 2-3 times during a shower :(
customer_reviews.text: We were very excited for this and purchased it a long time before we were finished with our home and able to install it. Now that we have used it for a few months I must say I am very disappointed!! The water will just turn to ice cold about 2-3 times during a 5 minute shower : ( VERY SAD!!! I would not recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Waite

customer_reviews.title: Good product but discounted reason not as stated
customer_reviews.text: Good product, purchased at discount due to cosmetic damage to case. No damage, but flame would not fire = no hot water. Had to purchase replacement elsewhere. Ended up with no hot water for 11 days. No mention in description that 110 electrical was needed entailing electrician as well as plumber.
customer_reviews.author: Pam White

customer_reviews.title: Easy fix
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I am not a professional plumber. But it was not a problem to connect hot water line, cold water line and a gas line to this heater after hanging it on the wall. Took me only an hour or so. I love how it only heats water when I need hot water and is off at all other times. Time will tell how efficient it is vs keeping a tank of water hot at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 4 months before I was able to install it, but after using it, I am loving it. It makes some odd noises when first powered on, but is quite quiet when in operation and delivers endless hot water. I especially like the remote themostat for it to be able to raise and lower the temp from inside the house.
customer_reviews.author: John A Davies

customer_reviews.title: As always, works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased over four of these for my various properties. Last on a few months ago for a cabin far from anyone. Used propane, connected a good water supply. Instant warm shower!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CHR

customer_reviews.title: Relatively low cost tankless water heater
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a gas tank with this tankless heater. It still takes a minute or so to get the shower as warm as I want it, but it does save on energy costs. One possible downside that it requires power to operate so a power outage means you’ll have to take cold showers
customer_reviews.author: TMan

customer_reviews.title: good hot water
customer_reviews.text: Best name and quality in water heaters in my opinion - had one for 12 years no problems and installed this one in parents home and they love it - make sure you order the valve kit and lower box cover so you dont have to make 2 or 3 different orders
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!! Should have swapped along time ago....easy too install if u have basic plumbing and wiring knowledge... been running a couple of months now ...UPDATE. ....it runs two showers at the same time with no problems... I was worried about that when I purchased it .... have been using about a year now with no problems ... great unit!!!!
customer_reviews.author: guy

customer_reviews.title: U need a tempeture control with it
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed bought a Rinnai v53De and after installing they said need to buy temperature control ,there was no sing or advice to buy with controller
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very weak unit
customer_reviews.text: This product does not do a good job with hot water pressure. It is very weak. When more than one hot water fixture is on, water pressure drops to almost zero. Unit was easy to install. Im using in a one bathroom home, one story house with fixtures 20 feet away from tankless unit. Don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Berry

customer_reviews.title: Constant hot water supply!
customer_reviews.text: Our 2nd Rinnai tankless water heater (the first one went with a house we sold). It works wonderfully well, giving us a never-ending supply of hot water. It operates very quietly, too. I don't plan on ever going back to a water heater with a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Don

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Come with Temperature Control
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tankless water heater but be clear that the Rinnai V53DeN does NOT come with any type of controller. it will NOT connect to wifi like the description says, you have to spend another $100 bucks to buy the separate controller.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: limited temperature selection
customer_reviews.text: I bought an expensive remote controller for the unit, as it does not come with one. Can only select between two temperatures. 120° f or 115° f. I would have preferred to be able to set a lower temperature for taking a shower.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: Excellant quality
customer_reviews.text: My last house had Rinnai heaters that ran for 12 years without any problems. I just purchased and installed two new ones for my new house. You'll never regret buying this product. Don't forget to apply for local rebates. My rebate was enough to pay to have the gas run from the meter to the units, not typically a DIY project.
customer_reviews.author: Syracuse Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Heater
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to install but straight forward. Replaced a 14 year old Bosch and this Rinnai works without the issues that the Bosch had, trouble free operation, works great to this point
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Decent unit and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Unit was installed by a local plumber with my help. Went up easily and without issue. So questions on electrical that conflicted with video instructions. So far the unit works as advertised for a small home.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Product is holding up to its promise!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my purchase of the tankless water heater. It has been one of the best decision I've ever made. Truly a blessing not having to worry about hot water running out . I can wash a warm load and still take a shower with continuous flow of hot water! Thanks happy customer so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Rinnai V series Tankless, the unit itself was easy to install. If you do not have gas or 120v Electrical nearby you'll need those installed. The unit was well packaged, installed easy and best of all clicked on the VERY First try. Plenty of Hot Water as hot as you want. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D Donson

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy
customer_reviews.text: It works great, the plumber seemed to install it fine, and the support was awesome getting me a new cover / door to fit the different vent compared to our old model Rinnai.
customer_reviews.author: R. Robb

customer_reviews.title: Excited about this one...
customer_reviews.text: I can't give an accurate account of functionality yet, as my new gas feed line isn't completely finished, but overall I'm impressed with how easy it was to hang this guy on the wall and just screw it in place. Make sure its level in all directions and opt for the lower cover as well
customer_reviews.author: William L.

customer_reviews.title: you will need 3/4 inch gas line
customer_reviews.text: this is the 3rd tankless heater I have owned and the best so far
customer_reviews.author: Eugene M.

customer_reviews.title: I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I was advised by the pro plumbing shop to buy a bigger unit for a duplex (2 bedrooms in each unit), but took a chance with this one, smaller but quite a bit cheaper. It has been performing perfectly so far, no complaints, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: FWAlmanac

customer_reviews.title: RV endless showers !!!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this on the temporary hookups on our rv, man it works great!!!!! Endless showers !!!
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: It was ok
customer_reviews.text: It's light, and practic BUT AGAIN, THE DELIVER DIDN'T ADVISE WHEN THEY ARRIVED..
customer_reviews.author: Humberto

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: This product has delivered consistent and reliable hot water. Installed during a kitchen renovation for whole house usage. Pleased with the results. Some concerns about vulnerability to the outside elements but no concerns thus far. Would recommend. Suggest purchasing the installation kit along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Tullos

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy installation only if you are mechanically inclined to do such installations. Otherwise, hire a professional! This unit is very quiet during operation. I would suggest that you buy the fancy valves that allow descaling.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D.

customer_reviews.title: The electrical hookup instructions are not very clear. unless you're an electrical engineer
customer_reviews.text: The unit is working fine but the 'motherboard' apparently isn't functional. lI was told by tech support that my plumber 'fried' it so I have to spend additional money to get a new one. I really don't think that it actually worked but they refuse to send me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Should of bought one earlier. Great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Got a family of 6 and with a tank style water heater taking showers was not an option. My bill has drastically been reduced. Great product.

customer_reviews.title: condition of shipment
customer_reviews.text: Item came broken welds and dented in front and sides
customer_reviews.author: John Ludwick

customer_reviews.title: Consistent and reliable
customer_reviews.text: We had this professionally installed for use with an outdoor shower. The unit has been installed less than a month but this far we are very pleased. The design is unobtrusive. The installation seemed easy for our professional. It provides constant and consistently heated water.
customer_reviews.author: Joel D. Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Unit hooked up very easy to my old Rinnai location with no problems. No modifications necessary. Unit had damage from UPS. The outer case cover had a dent in it, but no harmful effects to the operation of unit.
customer_reviews.author: Imfedup

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I only have a 3 bed house with one shower, kitchen sink and a washing machine to deal with. And this works perfect. Super hot water in about 5 to 10 seconds from opening up the tap
customer_reviews.author: michael collins

customer_reviews.title: Save water and get hotter water faster!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is absolutely a must-have for homes. It saves a ton of water and the hot water is pretty much instant. Just make sure you have someone qualified install it and off you go, with a lower bill and a faster speed for hot water.
customer_reviews.author: CsufAlumni08

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: We use this in a small restaurant and it saves us lots of money on electric

customer_reviews.text: We got a couple of cryptic error codes when we first installed it that required tech support, but once we got it going it is great.

customer_reviews.text: Love this!gives us so much hot water and we are a big family and can use up alot of hot water ! Was a great buy

customer_reviews.title: Have had this almost a year now. It is ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had this almost a year now. It is plumbed to both a bathroom and a kitchen. It works very well and I would buy again when we redo our other bathroom.

customer_reviews.title: Best Heater
customer_reviews.text: 3rd Rinnai. These things crank hot water as needed. Love not heating water when I’m gone

customer_reviews.text: This was a simple change-out/replacement of our old Rinnai unit which worked flawlessly for over 12 years. The water and gas lines on the new unit were essentially in the same location as the old unit which really made installation easy.

customer_reviews.text: For my size house 3100 sq ft you need 3 and at $1200 s piece to install it isn't worth the money.
